Pre-Game Insights: Colombia have maintained a 23-match unbeaten run heading into this Copa America clash.
Paraguay have failed to score in four of their last five matches.
Colombia’s Luis Diaz is just one goal away from reaching 50 caps and has netted 12 goals for the national team.
Colombia’s 23-match unbeaten streak highlights their consistency and resilience, particularly under Nestor Lorenzo’s management.
Paraguay, while struggling offensively with only one goal in their last five matches, have also shown a defensive rigidity, conceding just three goals in the same period.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stakes of the tournament opener, combined with the physical style of play both teams are known for, suggest a combative encounter.
Colombia average 2.5 yellow cards per game, while Paraguay are not far behind with 2.2 per match.
Colombia are expected to dominate possession and apply sustained pressure on Paraguay’s defence, it is likely they will win more corners.
Colombia average 3.3 corners per game, indicating their tendency to attack down the flanks and force defensive actions from their opponents.
Paraguay, focusing on counter-attacks and defensive solidity, might not venture forward as often, leading to fewer corners.
Others: Colombia will aim to dominate possession, create chances through intricate play in the final third, and maintain defensive solidity.
Paraguay will focus on a disciplined defensive structure and quick counters.
Colombia’s midfield, led by the experienced James Rodriguez and the industrious Jefferson Lerma, will be crucial in dictating the tempo.
Paraguay are expected to adopt a more conservative approach, focusing on deep defending and swift counter-attacks.
Colombia’s attacking threats like Luis Diaz and James Rodriguez can be expected to break the deadlock, but Paraguay’s disciplined defence will likely prevent a rout.
